quizData1.question: Seek knowledge from the cradle to the grave.
The pen is mightier than the sword.
Smiling to your brother is charity.
Whoever does not show mercy will not be shown mercy.
Modesty is a branch of faith.
Greed is the key to all evil.
The best among you are those who are best to their families.
Allah helps the servant as long as he helps his brother.

quizData2.question: Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day should speak good or remain silent.
Remembrance of Allah is the greatest virtue.
The strong believer is better and more beloved to Allah than the weak believer.
Allah does not look at your forms or wealth, but He looks at your hearts and deeds.
Seeking knowledge is obligatory upon every Muslim.
Verily, patience is at the first stroke of a calamity.
Actions are judged by their intentions and each person will be rewarded according to their intention.
The most beloved deeds to Allah are the ones that are continuous, even if they are small.
The believer does not slander, curse, or speak in an obscene or foul manner.
Paradise lies at the feet of mothers.
Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day, let them speak good or remain silent.
